attributes.action: Ask Ed Balls to write an online article in The Guardian newspaper in which he sets out clearly how he can believe that  the Badman Review is anything other than a wanton attack on both the family and on civil liberties.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Badman Review recommends that Local Authorities be entitled to enter family homes without permission.  It recommends further that Local Authority officials be permitted to remove children from the household for 'questioning,' without either the child's or the parent's consent. 

This highly disturbing Review constitutes an assault on the presumption of innocence until guilt is proven. Forced entry into the family homes of people suspected of no crime is a fundamental attack on civil liberties which must be robustly opposed.

Mr Balls has so far refused a debate on this issue.  An online article in The Guardian would allow Mr Balls to explain why he believes in Badman and its recommendations.  It would also allow him to read the responses of all those parents he has so far ignored in  his bogus 'consultations.'  

The Guardian is the forum of choice for this debate because it has a trusted policy on blogs.
